result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Thomas W Howell was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DE has credit for one day.

miscConds.notes: DE will be given credit for cost of assessment after proof is provided to COCC office.
DE allowed huber for employment,  DE will be allowed to return to Mexico for winter employment.

The Court orders that if the defendant fails to pay the fine and costs within 60 days of the date of conviction or if the Court has authorized monthly payments for the fine and costs and they have not been paid, the Court will enter a judgment and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect this debt.  You must keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.
DE has completed assessment, will be allowed credit off fine when proof is provided to COCC office.

timeConds.notes: 30 days conditonal jail time ordered, will be allowed huber and credit for good time.

records.addlTxt: COC spoke with DE about DE request to travel out of State.  Judge indicated the decision  for the DE to travel out of state would be the probation and parole agent's decision.

for ignition interlock exemptions and removing title transfer stops
Proof of IDIP class
DE has indicated he does not intend to seek PCR

Defendant Thomas W Howell in court with attorney Michael R. Cohen.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Cohen recites agreement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights. 

 DE will enter a plea to amended Ct 2, amended to OWI 3rd, DE will have 125 days jail imposed/stayed,  Court will order one year probation, 30 days conditional jail, allowed credit for good time and huber privilege, has one day credit,  pay a fine of $2122.00, will subtract the cost of assessment when proof is provided to COCC office, $22.90 restitution to DA office, 24 month revocation of DL, 12 month IID, DE will be placed on one year probation, DE will be allowed to return to Mexico for employment which he does during the winter months.  DE will enter a plea of Guilty, court accepts and finds the DE guilty,  Ct 1 will be DRI, Ct 3 dismissed.  DE will begin jail time today.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties.
Sentencing hearing on December 27, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Attorney Michael R. Cohen in court.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE is not present, is currently is Mexico for the winter months.  Atty Cohen says agreement has been reached in this matter, DE will be returning to WI in December, Set for sentencing 12-27-16 @ 8:00AM.
